gurmukhi: kop gdw kr lY Gn sXwm su S`qR ky sIs pY Gwau lgwXo ] pRwn qjXo mn cMf BjXo iqh ko qn qwih ky lok isDwXo ]1335]
transliteration: Kop Gadaa Kar Lai Ghan Syaam Su Shattra Ke Sees Pai Ghaao Lagadyo|| Praan Tajyo Man Channd Bhajyo Tih Ko Tan Taah(i) Ke Lok Sidhaayo||1335||
translation: In great fury, Krishna struck a blow with his mace on the head of the enemy and with that remembering Chandi in his mind, Shakti Singh breathed his last; the body of Shakti Singh also went to the region of Chandi.1335.

gurmukhi: pRwn clXo iqh ko qb hI jb hI qn cMf ky log pDwrXo ] sUrj ieMdR snwidk jy sur hUM imil kY js qwih aucwrXo ]
transliteration: Praan Chadyo Tih Ko Tab Hitan Channd Ke Log Padhdaryo|| Sooraj Indra Sanaadik Je Sur Hoon Mil(i) Kai Jas Taah(i) Ouchdaryo||
translation: With the body going to the region of Chandi, his Pranas (life-breaths) also moved; the gods like Surya, Indra, Sanak, Sanandan etc., began to describe his praises;

gurmukhi: AYso n Awgy lrXo rn mY koaU AwpnI bYis mY nwih inhwrXo ] sRI SkqyS blI Dn hY hir so lir kY prlok isDwrXo ]1336]
transliteration: Aiso Na Aage Daryo Ran Mai Ko( i)  Oopanibais(i) Mai Naah(i) Nihdaryo|| Srishaktesh Balidhan Hai Har(i) So Lar(i) Kai Parlok Sidhdaryo||1336||
translation: They all said, “We have not seen such a fighter in our life; bravo to the mighty warrior Shakti Singh, who has reached the next world after fighting with Krishna.1336.

gurmukhi: jbY cMf ko hir bru pwXo ] skiq isMG ko mwr igrwXo ] Aaur S`qR bhu gey prweI ] riv inhwr jXo qm n rhweI ]1337]
transliteration: Jobai Channd Ko Har(i) Bar(u) Paayo|| Sakat(i) Singh Ko Maar Giraayo|| Aur Shattra Bahu Gad Paraaee|| Rav(i) Nihaar Jyo Tam Naa Rahaaee||1337||
translation: When Krishna obtained the boon from Chandi, then he knocked down Shakti Singh; many of other enemies ran away like the darkness on seeing the sun.1337.

gurmukhi: ieiq sRI bicqR nwtk gRMQy kiRSnwvqwry ju`D pRbMDy duAwds BUp skiq isMG suDw bDih iDAwie smwpqm ]
transliteration: It(i) Sribachitra Naatak Granthe Karishnaavatdare Juddh Prabandhe Duaadas Bhoop Sakat(i) Singh Sudhaa Badhah(i) Bhiaae Samaaptam||
translation: End of the Chapter entitled “Killing of Twelve Kings including Shakti Singh in Warfare” in Krishnavatara in Bachittar Natak.
Now begins the description of the war with five kings

gurmukhi: Asm isMG js isMG puin ieMdR isMG blvwn ] ABY isMG sUro bfo ie`C isMG sur gXwn ]1338]
transliteration: Asam Singh Jas Singh Poun(i) Indra Singh Balvaan|| Abhai Singh Sooro Bado Ichchh Singh Sur Gyaan||1338||
translation: There were powerful and learned warriors in the battlefield like Asam Singh, Jas Singh, Inder Singh, Abhai Singh and Ichh Singh.1338.

gurmukhi: cmUM BjI BUpn lKI cly ju`D ky kwj ] AhMkwr pwNco kIXo Aju hin hY jdurwj ]1339]
transliteration: Chamoond Bhajibhoopan Lakhichale Juddh Ke Kaaj|| Ahankaar Paancho Keeyo Aj(u) Han(i) Hai Jaduraaj||1339||
translation: When these kings saw the army running away, they marched forward to fight; all the five said proudly, “We shall definitely kill Krishna, the Lord of Yadavas.”1339.

gurmukhi: auq qy AwXuD lY sBY Awey kop bFwie ] ieq qy hir smuhy Bey sXMdn SIGR Dvwie ]1340]
transliteration: Out Te Aayudh Lai Sabhai Aae Kop Badhaae|| It Te Har(i) Samuhe Bhae Syandan Sheeghra Dhavaae||1340||
translation: On the side, taking their weapons in their hands and in great rage, all of them came forward and from this side Krishna god his chariot driven and reached in front of them.1340.
